isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB AIR RIDE (9200/9300/9400 DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES)

svcproc.title: CAB AIR RIDE (9200/9300/9400 DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 73 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

figure.caption: Figure 73. 9200/9300/9400 Day Cab Without Detroit Diesel Engines

calloutgroup.callout1: 11. HEX HEAD SCREW AND WASHER, 5/16-18 UNC X 1

svcprocinfo.para: The cab air ride system for 9200, 9300 and 9400 day cab models without Detroit Diesel engines contains two air springs (bags) (Item 6), two shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9), and is controlled by the cab air ride valve (Item 3). The air ride components are not interchangeable with different cab models.

The following components - air lines (Item 10), fittings (Item 4), air springs (Item 6), cab air ride valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) and track bar rod (Item 2) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve, air springs (bags) and shock absorbers are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para: Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and connections (Figure 73). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of components.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and is supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Valve - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 74 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Disconnect the air line connection (Item 8) from the cab air ride valve (Item 1).
Disconnect the horizontal adjuster rod (Item 6) from the cab air ride valve.
Remove the cab air ride valve (Item 1) from the track bar mount bracket (Item 5, Figure 3.70) by removing bolts (Item 7).
Install the cab air ride valve (Item 1) and secure it to track bar mount bracket with the mounting bolts (Item 7). Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).
Connect the air line connection (Item 8) to the cab air ride valve (Item 1).
Turn the valve so the dot (mark) on the face of the rotating selector is in the down position ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Location of Mark on Valve Adjuster Face

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SHOWS LOCATION OF MARK (DOT) OR ARROW ON VALVE ADJUSTER FACE. MARK MUST FACE IN THE DOWN POSITION.

step1.para: Install horizontal adjuster rod (Item 6) onto cab air ride valve (Item 1). Be sure horizontal adjuster rod is properly seated into cab air ride valve before tightening adjuster rod lock bolt (Item 4) [vertical adjuster rod (Item 3) is perpendicular].
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab height between the bottom of the upper mounting plate and the top of the lower mounting plate crossmember. Cab air suspension ride height is 7-3/4 inches ( Figure 76). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM (9200/9300/9400 DAY CAB MODELS).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber - Remove

step1.para: Open hood to full tilt position.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and is supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

step1.para: Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Place Jack on Frame Rail Flange and Back of Cab Floor Frame

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 73 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Raise cab for enough clearance to remove shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9).

caution.para: Over raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Remove shock absorber (Item 9) with washer and spacer (Items 13 and 14) by removing hex head screws and washers (Item 11) at the top of the shock absorber. Then remove flanged hex lock nut and washer (Items 12 and 13) at the bottom of the shock absorber.
Remove shock absorber (Item 8) by removing hex head screws and washers (Item 11) at the top and bottom of the shock absorber.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 73 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position shock absorber (Item 8) in place and secure with hex head screws and washers (Item 11) at the top and bottom of the shock absorber.

Position shock absorber (Item 9) with washer and spacer (Items 13 and 14) in place at the bottom of the shock absorber and secure with flanged hex lock nut and washer (Items 12 and 13). Then install hex head screws and washers (Item 11) at the top of the shock absorber. Tighten flanged hex lock nut (Item 12) to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 Nm).
Release jack and lower cab.
Close and latch hood.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Remove

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Open hood to full tilt position.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 73 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove the air lines and fittings (Items 10 and 4) from the bottom of the air spring (bag) (Item 6).
Remove the push-on ring (Item 15) at the top and bottom stud of the air spring (bag) (Item 6).
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 3.74).
Raise cab for enough clearance to remove air spring (bag) (Item 6).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Remove the air spring (bag) (Item 6) from between the cab upper mounting bracket (Item 1) and the cab lower mounting bracket (Item 7).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 73 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position the air spring (bag) (Item 6) in place between the cab upper mounting bracket (Item 1) and the cab lower mounting bracket (Item 7).
Release jack and lower cab.
Secure the air spring (bag) (Item 6) with the push-on ring (Item 15) at the top and bottom stud of the air spring (bag).
Install the air lines and fittings (Items 10 and 4) at the bottom of the air spring (bag) (Item 6).
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.
Close and latch hood.

Check cab height between the bottom of the upper mounting plate and the top of the lower mounting plate crossmember. If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM (9200/9300/9400 DAY CAB MODELS).
